sentences: Steve Rodway (born in Cambridgeshire), also known under the alias Motiv 8 or Motiv8, is a British electronic dance music producer, songwriter, remixer and sound engineer.

Afterwards, Rodway began his remixing career, with an early remix of "Listen to the Music" by The Doobie Brothers (peaking at #37 UK, only a week after "Rockin' for Myself" peaked) opening up further opportunities.
Following the success of "Common People", Rodway remixed "Disco 2000".
In 1997, Rodway took on remixing "Addicted to Love" by Robert Palmer, the best known song he had worked on to date.
In December 1995, he was introduced to Australian singer Gina G, who had come across Rodway through an early demo called "Just a Little Bit" produced by Simon Tauber.
Rodway produced a brand new version which went on to be selected as the United Kingdom's entry in the Eurovision Song Contest 1996.
Rodway provided additional production on Pet Shop Boys' 1997 hit "A Red Letter Day".
In 2000 Rodway began to experiment with changes to the Motiv8 sound.
The synthesizer riffs in "On A Night Like This" are good examples of his technique.
1995 "Searching for the Golden Eye" (featuring Kym Mazelle)
1995 Mary Kiani– "When I Call Your Name"
2000 Kylie Minogue – "On A Night Like This"
2001 KT Oslin – "Come On A My House"
2001 LeAnn Rimes – "But I Do Love You"
1999 Motiv8tion: The Official Motiv 8 Remix Collection, Volume 1
